reviewText: Well, as a super cheesy Christmas movie when you have super young kids, it is fine.  But for anything beyond that, it is a waste of time.  There were to pieces to this that I found rather disturbing.  First of all - the part where the boyfriend was willing to accept her no matter what he found about her past.  That there was no way that she could be a bad person or do anything that would make him change his view of her. Oookay.  Let's say (because this has happened) that she regains her memory and it just so happens that she is a mother with a husband.  All of a sudden NO MATTER WHAT HER PAST doesn't matter takes on a new light.  Of course this was a cheesy movie as I said - but there are good reasons why not to just go jumping into something without checking your own selfish reasons at the door.  Specially at a time like Christmas he should have considered that angle, not just how much HE loved her - because then, it isn't about her or her well being - it is about him.Second - the "magic" pen and cookie moment was unnecessary. Fine, she had magic - but why those scenes?
Title: Twice Upon A Christmas

reviewText: I bought this as the beginning of my daughter's Christmas Movie Collection.  It made a great gift for her and she has already watched it several times.
Title: Twice Upon A Christmas

reviewText: This movie was in good condition the case was a bit tattered and there was a tiny scratch on the disc that caused a tiny skip during playing it but overall it was an excellent purchase
Title: Twice Upon A Christmas

reviewText: I could not have "once Upon A Christmas", without adding this one to the library so the story can be finished.  It is a wonderful story which is very well acted, and John Dye and Kathy Ireland add a dimension of integrity to the movies plot.
summary: This movie is partially responsible for my growing love of Christmas movies.  If you buy them, you won't regret it.
Title: Twice Upon A Christmas

reviewText: excellent DVD.  very pleased with the movie. I love Christmas movies and had just watched the movie on Hallmark Channel.  I was very happy to see Amazon had it available.
Title: Twice Upon A Christmas
